comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] The November 1908 date on [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper/]'s version means the photo was taken in 1907/8.  There is a fair amount of articles in Trove about the Sly brothers and their boat,  which must have been the first surf rescue rowboat,  like the ones which still race but rarely rescue anyone.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It seems that the Sly brothers were appointed by Manly Council in 1903 (as John said - shortly after daylight bathing was allowed there). So I guess the image could be anytime after that. I agree with John that it is probably a year or two after these activities started and began to gain some notoriety.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
